questions.question: What is React?
options: A library for building user interfaces
A framework for building mobile apps

questions.question: Who developed React?
Which of the following is used to pass data to a component from outside?
Which method is used to create a component in React?
What is JSX?
What is the use of `setState` in React?
Which of the following is not a lifecycle method in React?
What does the `render` method return?
What is the default port where the webpack-dev-server runs?
In which lifecycle method do you typically make API calls?
What tool can you use to transpile JSX?
What is the significance of keys in React?
options: They are used to identify elements in the virtual DOM
They are used to pass props
They are used to handle events
They are used to manage state

questions.question: Which of the following is true about React components?
options: They can only be defined as classes
They can only be defined as functions
They can be defined as classes or functions
They must be defined inside another component

questions.question: What does the `componentDidMount` lifecycle method do?
options: Executes after the component is mounted
Executes before the component is mounted

questions.question: How do you write an inline style in React?
What is the use of refs in React?
options: To directly access a DOM element

questions.question: What does the `shouldComponentUpdate` method do?
options: It forces a component to update
It prevents a component from updating
It returns a boolean indicating whether the component should update
It sets the state of the component

questions.question: How do you pass a value from a child component to a parent component?
What is the purpose of the `super` keyword in a React class constructor?
options: To call the constructor of the parent class

questions.question: Which method in React is used to update the state?
